Package cs2810.group30.oaxacabackend.controller

Class OrderController

java.lang.Object
cs2810.group30.oaxacabackend.controller.OrderController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/order") @CrossOrigin public class OrderController extends Object
A controller for Orders, uses the "/order" mapping

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Orders
    add(Orders order)
    Use "/add" on PostMapping to save the order to the database (generates the OrderID randomly), returns the Order added to the database.
    Orders
    changeStatus(String id, String status)
    Use "/changeStatus/" followed by the orderId and new status on putMapping to find an order by it's ID and change it's completionStatus to match status, returns null if the ID is not valid.
    Orders
    changeWaiter(String id, String newWaiter)
    Use "/changeWaiter/" followed by the OrderId and new waiter on putMapping to find an order by it's ID and change it's waiterName field to match newWaiter, returns null if the ID is not valid.
    void
    deleteAll()
    Use "/deleteAll" on deleteMapping to delete all Orders and OrderItems in the database.

    Use "/delete/" followed by the Id on deleteMapping to find the order associated with the ID and delete it.

    Use "/getByStatus/" followed by the status on getMapping to return a list of all of the orders that match the completionStatus provided in order from oldest to newest.

    Use "/getOrder/" on getMapping followed by the orderId to return a specific order associated with the Id given, or an empty Optional if no such order with that ID exists..

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderController

      public OrderController()

  • Method Details

    • add

      @PostMapping("/add") public Orders add(@RequestBody Orders order)
      Use "/add" on PostMapping to save the order to the database (generates the OrderID randomly), returns the Order added to the database.
      Parameters:
      order - Provided in the request body is the order to be added to the db with a new random ID(if the provided order has a UID it will be overwritten).
      Returns:
      The order saved to the db (with new UID).

    • list

      @GetMapping("/getAll") public List<Orders> list()
      Use "/getAll" on getMapping to return all orders in the database sorted by completionStatus (in alphabetical order).
      Returns:
      A list of all of the Orders in the db sorted by completionStatus.

    • getOrders

      @GetMapping("/getOrder/{id}") public Optional<Orders> getOrders(@PathVariable String id)
      Use "/getOrder/" on getMapping followed by the orderId to return a specific order associated with the Id given, or an empty Optional if no such order with that ID exists..
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the order that should be returned.
      Returns:
      An Optional which contains the order that's associated with the given ID, Optional is empty if the ID was not valid.

    • getByStatus

      @GetMapping("/getByStatus/{status}") public List<Orders> getByStatus(@PathVariable String status)
      Use "/getByStatus/" followed by the status on getMapping to return a list of all of the orders that match the completionStatus provided in order from oldest to newest.
      Parameters:
      status - The completionStatus that you want to search by.
      Returns:
      A List of all orders with completionStatus matching status, in order from oldest to newest.

    • changeStatus

      @PutMapping("/changeStatus/{id}/{status}") public Orders changeStatus(@PathVariable String id, @PathVariable String status)
      Use "/changeStatus/" followed by the orderId and new status on putMapping to find an order by it's ID and change it's completionStatus to match status, returns null if the ID is not valid.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the order to change the completionStatus of.
      status - The newStatus that'll overwrite the previous completionStatus.
      Returns:
      The new Order saved to the db, or null if the ID is not valid.

    • changeWaiter

      @PutMapping("/changeWaiter/{id}/{newWaiter}") public Orders changeWaiter(@PathVariable String id, @PathVariable String newWaiter)
      Use "/changeWaiter/" followed by the OrderId and new waiter on putMapping to find an order by it's ID and change it's waiterName field to match newWaiter, returns null if the ID is not valid.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the order to change the waiterName of.
      newWaiter - The newWaiter name that'll overwrite the previous waitername.
      Returns:
      The new Order saved to the db, or null if the ID is not valid.

    • setPaid

      @PutMapping("/isPaid/{id}") public Orders setPaid(@PathVariable String id)
      Use "/isPaid/" followed by the OrderId to set it's paid field to true.
      Parameters:
      id - The Order Id of the order to have its payed field set to true.
      Returns:
      The modified Order.

    • deleteOrder

      @DeleteMapping("/delete/{id}") public boolean deleteOrder(@PathVariable String id)
      Use "/delete/" followed by the Id on deleteMapping to find the order associated with the ID and delete it.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the order to be deleted.
      Returns:
      True if the order is deleted, or false if it couldn't be (because the ID isn't valid).

    • deleteAll

      @DeleteMapping("/deleteAll") public void deleteAll()
      Use "/deleteAll" on deleteMapping to delete all Orders and OrderItems in the database.

    • queryLength

      @GetMapping("/queryLength/{status}") public int queryLength(@PathVariable String status)
      Use "/queryLength/" followed by status on getMapping to get the number of Orders of that status.
      Parameters:
      status - The status you're trying to find the quantity of.
      Returns:
      an int representing the number of Orders with the given status exist in the database.

    • queryLengthAll

      @GetMapping("/queryLengthAll") public int queryLengthAll()
      Use "/queryLengthAll" on getMapping to get the number of total orders in the database.
      Returns:
      An int representing the number of Orders in the database right now.

    • todayIWasTheSword

      @GetMapping("/getStats") public List<Integer> todayIWasTheSword()
      Custom method for the dashboard, use "/getStats" on getMapping to recieve an array detailing the number of pending, in progress, confirmed and total orders as an list of ints.
      Returns:
      A List of ints representing the number of pending, inProgress, confirmed and total orders.
